description: ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match those of the existing building in materials, style, colour, texture and, in the case of brickwork, bonding, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no opening shall be constructed in the extensions south east facing flank wall without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
It is considered that the proposed enlargement of the dwellinghouse would respect the design and form of the existing building, would preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Merton (Wimbledon North) Conservation Area, and would not have a harmful impact on neighbouring amenity.The proposal accords with the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.

Adopted Merton Unitary Development Plan (October 2003):-
BE.1   (Conservation Areas, New Development, Change of Use, Alterations and Extensions)
BE.15 (New Buildings and Extensions; Daylight; Sunlight; Privacy; Visual Intrusions and Noise)
BE.23 (Alterations and Extensions to Buildings).

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE 
The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link:	
http://www.communities.gov.uk/documents/planningandbuilding/pdf/133214.pdf
